and finitely many factors in the product may not be the most natural ones.  Formally we have
3
but for general Г the product ( 2.  3 ) is only known to converge in R ( s ) and it is
not known whether it can be continued analytically outside this region. 
If Г ( possibly defined over an algebraic number field ) admits complex multi plication,  Deuring [ 9 ] has shown that Lp ( s ) can be analytically continued over the whole plane and satisfies a functional equation.  By this means he also found a natural form for the missing factors in ( 2.  3 ), namely that which makes the functional equation as simple as possible.
